title: Twin Cities Kids Indoor Fun
name: Twin Cities Kids Indoor Fun
description:
A Map by Trekbody

These are great places to bring your kids in the winter, when you and they are sick of the house.

properties.name: Adventure Park of Ham Lake
properties.description: Posted by Trekbody   14200 Lincoln St., 5530414200 Lincoln St., Ham Lake, MN 55304 Adventure Park is a wonderful indoor play area. Larger than others we have been at, it has ample seating for adults, nice play areas - reasonable snacks and a highly visible environment kids can play in. It is a business, so it is pay-to-play - but reasonable.

properties.name: Bruentrup Farm
properties.description: Posted by Trekbody Site of the Maplewood Historical Society - the farm is located right in the heart of Maplewood.

properties.name: Como Conservatory (Marjorie McNeely Conservatory)
properties.description: Posted by Trekbody  Como ConservatoryGranted, children will more likely be engaged with the animals in the adjoining zoo, but the Conservatory has just been expanded with a rain forest added to it\'s already beautiful displays. There are also outdoor gardens and paths to wander.

properties.name: Mall Of America
properties.description: Posted by Deejayneko spent 3-4 years of my life working away the day. met many people i would later consider enemies, some i would consider bold loves.

properties.name: Maplewood Mall Play Area
properties.description: Posted by Trekbody   55110Not only does Maplewood Mall have a free (although mediocre) play area at the food court - they have a (paid) carousel.

properties.name: Minneapolis Central Library
properties.description: Posted by Broccoli Really impressive, welcoming building by Cesar Pelli. Plenty of room for kids, teens, adults. Good chance you\'ll find what you want--if not put it on hold. Bonus for train-obsessed kids: only a block from the Hiawatha Light Rail.

properties.name: Minneapolis Institute of Arts
properties.description: Posted by Broccoli   minneapolis mnArt, ancient to modern, from all over the world. The interactive computer stations are cool, and it has a kids space with funky toys on the first floor.

properties.name: Rosedale Mall
properties.description: Posted by Trekbody   10 Rosedale Center, 5511310 Rosedale Center, 55113 The Northwoods play area at the Rosedale mall is great for younger kids. It has large foam structures to climb on in an enclosed area. Some of the structures have become damaged in recent months, so I\'m not sure what the state of repair is, but kids are tough on the stuff, so it is understandable.

properties.name: Shoreview Community Center
properties.description: Posted by Trekbody Shoreview Community CenterShoreview community center has a very nice indoor water-park with a small pool for the little ones and a larger pool for the big kids. The large water-slide is particularly thrilling.

properties.name: The Depot Waterpark (at the Marriott)
properties.description: Posted by Trekbody   225 Third Ave. South, 55401The Marriott Depot Waterpark features one, four-story water slide, three kiddie slides and a hot tub. Address: 225 Third Ave South Minneapolis MN USA 55401

properties.name: Woodbury's Central Park
properties.description: Posted by Trekbody  8505 Valley Creek Rd, 55125An indoor park, library, and child play area called Lookout Ridge - Central Park is hard to beat.
